This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars, echo=FALSE}
colombiaSDF <- readRDS("COL_adm2.rds")


metro <- colombiaSDF[colombiaSDF$NAME_1 == "Cundinamarca", ]
  

my_map <- leaflet(metro) %>% 
     addTiles() %>%
     clearShapes() %>%
     addPolygons(stroke = FALSE, smoothFactor = 0, 
                  fillColor = "RED", fillOpacity = 0.7, 
                  layerId = ~NAME_2)
my_map
    


      addProviderTiles('CartoDB.Positron') %>%
      clearShapes() %>%
      addPolygons(stroke = FALSE, smoothFactor = 0, 
                  fillColor = ~pal(entropy), fillOpacity = 0.7, 
                  layerId = ~GEOID) %>%
      addLegend(position = 'bottomright', pal = pal, 
                values = metro()$entropy, title = 'Score')
```
